intro: Androsace pubescens var. cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical arete, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette, and it produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers in early spring. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
